00053 /*
00054  * Infrastructure to support tracking of last committed llog record
00055  */
00056 struct osp_id_tracker {
00057         spinlock_t               otr_lock;
00058         __u32                    otr_next_id;
00059         __u32                    otr_committed_id;
00060         /* callback is register once per diskfs -- that's the whole point */
00061         struct dt_txn_callback   otr_tx_cb;
00062         /* single node can run many clusters */
00063         struct list_head         otr_wakeup_list;
00064         struct list_head         otr_list;
00065         /* underlying shared device */
00066         struct dt_device        *otr_dev;
00067         /* how many users of this tracker */
00068         atomic_t                 otr_refcount;
00069 };
00070 
00071 struct osp_precreate {
00072         /*
00073          * Precreation pool
00074          */
00075         spinlock_t                       osp_pre_lock;
00076 
00077         /* last fid to assign in creation */
00078         struct lu_fid                    osp_pre_used_fid;
00079         /* last created id OST reported, next-created - available id's */
00080         struct lu_fid                    osp_pre_last_created_fid;
00081         /* how many ids are reserved in declare, we shouldn't block in create */
00082         __u64                            osp_pre_reserved;
00083         /* consumers (who needs new ids) wait here */
00084         wait_queue_head_t                osp_pre_user_waitq;
00085         /* current precreation status: working, failed, stopping? */
00086         int                              osp_pre_status;
00087         /* how many objects to precreate next time */
00088         int                              osp_pre_create_count;
00089         int                              osp_pre_min_create_count;
00090         int                              osp_pre_max_create_count;
00091         /* whether to increase precreation window next time or not */
00092         int                              osp_pre_create_slow;
00093         /* cleaning up orphans or recreating missing objects */
00094         int                              osp_pre_recovering;
00095 };
00096 
00097 struct osp_update_request_sub {
00098         struct object_update_request    *ours_req; /* may be vmalloc'd */
00099         size_t                          ours_req_size;
00100         /* Linked to osp_update_request->our_req_list */
00101         struct list_head                ours_list;
00102 };
00103 
00104 struct osp_update_request {
00105         int                             our_flags;
00106         /* update request result */
00107         int                             our_rc;
00108 
00109         /* List of osp_update_request_sub */
00110         struct list_head                our_req_list;
00111         int                             our_req_nr;
00112         int                             our_update_nr;
00113 
00114         struct list_head                our_cb_items;
00115 
00116         /* points to thandle if this update request belongs to one */
00117         struct osp_thandle              *our_th;
00118 
00119         __u64                           our_version;
00120         /* protect our_list and flag */
00121         spinlock_t                      our_list_lock;
00122         /* linked to the list(ou_list) in osp_updates */
00123         struct list_head                our_list;
00124         __u32                           our_batchid;
00125         __u32                           our_req_ready:1;
00126 
00127 };

00129 struct osp_updates {
00130         struct list_head        ou_list;
00131         spinlock_t              ou_lock;
00132         wait_queue_head_t       ou_waitq;
00133         /* wait for next updates */
00134         __u64                   ou_rpc_version;
00135         __u64                   ou_version;
00136 };

00138 struct osp_device {
00139         struct dt_device                 opd_dt_dev;
00140         /* corresponded OST index */
00141         int                              opd_index;
00142 
00143         /* corrsponded MDT index, which will be used when connecting to OST
00144          * for validating the connection (see ofd_parse_connect_data) */
00145         int                              opd_group;
00146         /* device used to store persistent state (llogs, last ids) */
00147         struct obd_export               *opd_storage_exp;
00148         struct dt_device                *opd_storage;
00149         struct dt_object                *opd_last_used_oid_file;
00150         struct dt_object                *opd_last_used_seq_file;
00151 
00152         /* stored persistently in LE format, updated directly to/from disk
00153          * and required le64_to_cpu() conversion before use.
00154          * Protected by opd_pre_lock */
00155         struct lu_fid                   opd_last_used_fid;
00156         struct lu_fid                   opd_gap_start_fid;
00157         int                              opd_gap_count;
00158         /* connection to OST */
00159         struct obd_device               *opd_obd;
00160         struct obd_export               *opd_exp;
00161         struct obd_uuid                  opd_cluuid;
00162         struct obd_connect_data         *opd_connect_data;
00163         int                              opd_connects;
00164         struct proc_dir_entry           *opd_proc_entry;
00165         struct lprocfs_stats            *opd_stats;
00166         /* connection status. */
00167         unsigned int                     opd_new_connection:1,
00168                                          opd_got_disconnected:1,
00169                                          opd_imp_connected:1,
00170                                          opd_imp_active:1,
00171                                          opd_imp_seen_connected:1,
00172                                          opd_connect_mdt:1;
00173 
00174         /* whether local recovery is completed:
00175          * reported via ->ldo_recovery_complete() */
00176         int                              opd_recovery_completed;
00177 
00178         /* precreate structure for OSP */
00179         struct osp_precreate            *opd_pre;
00180         /* dedicate precreate thread */
00181         struct ptlrpc_thread             opd_pre_thread;
00182         /* thread waits for signals about pool going empty */
00183         wait_queue_head_t                opd_pre_waitq;
00184 
00185         /* send update thread */
00186         struct osp_updates              *opd_update;
00187         /* dedicate update thread */
00188         struct ptlrpc_thread             opd_update_thread;
00189 
00190         /*
00191          * OST synchronization
00192          */
00193         spinlock_t                       opd_syn_lock;
00194         /* unique generation, to recognize start of new records in the llog */
00195         struct llog_gen                  opd_syn_generation;
00196         /* number of changes to sync, used to wake up sync thread */
00197         unsigned long                    opd_syn_changes;
00198         /* processing of changes from previous mount is done? */
00199         int                              opd_syn_prev_done;
00200         /* found records */
00201         struct ptlrpc_thread             opd_syn_thread;
00202         wait_queue_head_t                opd_syn_waitq;
00203         /* list of inflight rpc */
00204         struct list_head                 opd_syn_inflight_list;
00205         /* list of remotely committed rpc */
00206         struct list_head                 opd_syn_committed_there;
00207         /* number of changes being under sync */
00208         int                              opd_syn_sync_in_progress;
00209         /* number of RPCs in flight - flow control */
00210         int                              opd_syn_rpc_in_flight;
00211         int                              opd_syn_max_rpc_in_flight;
00212         /* number of RPC in processing (including non-committed by OST) */
00213         int                              opd_syn_rpc_in_progress;
00214         int                              opd_syn_max_rpc_in_progress;
00215         /* osd api's commit cb control structure */
00216         struct dt_txn_callback           opd_syn_txn_cb;
00217         /* last used change number -- semantically similar to transno */
00218         unsigned long                    opd_syn_last_used_id;
00219         /* last committed change number -- semantically similar to
00220          * last_committed */
00221         unsigned long                    opd_syn_last_committed_id;
00222         /* last processed (taken from llog) id */
00223         unsigned long                    opd_syn_last_processed_id;
00224         struct osp_id_tracker           *opd_syn_tracker;
00225         struct list_head                 opd_syn_ontrack;
00226         /* stop processing new requests until barrier=0 */
00227         atomic_t                         opd_syn_barrier;
00228         wait_queue_head_t                opd_syn_barrier_waitq;
00229 
00230         /*
00231          * statfs related fields: OSP maintains it on its own
00232          */
00233         struct obd_statfs                opd_statfs;
00234         cfs_time_t                       opd_statfs_fresh_till;
00235         struct timer_list                        opd_statfs_timer;
00236         int                              opd_statfs_update_in_progress;
00237         /* how often to update statfs data */
00238         int                              opd_statfs_maxage;
00239 
00240         struct proc_dir_entry           *opd_symlink;
00241 
00242         /* If the caller wants to do some idempotent async operations on
00243          * remote server, it can append the async remote requests on the
00244          * osp_device::opd_async_requests via declare() functions, these
00245          * requests can be packed together and sent to the remote server
00246          * via single OUT RPC later. */
00247         struct osp_update_request       *opd_async_requests;
00248         /* Protect current operations on opd_async_requests. */
00249         struct mutex                     opd_async_requests_mutex;
00250         struct list_head                 opd_async_updates;
00251         struct rw_semaphore              opd_async_updates_rwsem;
00252         atomic_t                         opd_async_updates_count;
00253 };

00269 /* The first part of oxe_buf is xattr name, and is '\0' terminated.
00270  * The left part is for value, binary mode. */
00271 struct osp_xattr_entry {
00272         struct list_head         oxe_list;
00273         atomic_t                 oxe_ref;
00274         void                    *oxe_value;
00275         size_t                   oxe_buflen;
00276         size_t                   oxe_namelen;
00277         size_t                   oxe_vallen;
00278         unsigned int             oxe_exist:1,
00279                                  oxe_ready:1;
00280         char                     oxe_buf[0];
00281 };

00286 };

00288 /* this is a top object */
00289 struct osp_object {
00290         struct lu_object_header opo_header;
00291         struct dt_object        opo_obj;
00292         unsigned int            opo_reserved:1,
00293                                 opo_non_exist:1,
00294                                 opo_stale:1;
00295 
00296         /* read/write lock for md osp object */
00297         struct rw_semaphore     opo_sem;
00298         const struct lu_env     *opo_owner;
00299         struct osp_object_attr *opo_ooa;
00300         /* Protect opo_ooa. */
00301         spinlock_t              opo_lock;
00302 };

00309 struct osp_thread_info {
00310         struct lu_buf            osi_lb;
00311         struct lu_buf            osi_lb2;

00319                 struct llog_rec_hdr             osi_hdr;
00320                 struct llog_unlink64_rec        osi_unlink;
00321                 struct llog_setattr64_rec       osi_setattr;
00322                 struct llog_gen_rec             osi_gen;
00323         };
00324         struct llog_cookie       osi_cookie;
00325         struct llog_catid        osi_cid;
00326         struct lu_seq_range      osi_seq;
00327         struct ldlm_res_id       osi_resid;
00328         struct obdo              osi_obdo;
00329 };

00331 /* Iterator for OSP */
00332 struct osp_it {

00334         __u32                     ooi_pos_lu_page;

00348 #define OSP_THANDLE_MAGIC       0x20141214
00349 struct osp_thandle {
00350         struct thandle           ot_super;
00351 
00352         /* OSP will use this thandle to update last oid*/
00353         struct thandle          *ot_storage_th;
00354         __u32                    ot_magic;
00355         struct list_head         ot_commit_dcb_list;
00356         struct list_head         ot_stop_dcb_list;
00357         struct osp_update_request *ot_our;
00358         atomic_t                 ot_refcount;
00359 };
00360 
00361 static inline struct osp_thandle *
00362 thandle_to_osp_thandle(struct thandle *th)
00363 {
00364         return container_of(th, struct osp_thandle, ot_super);
00365 }
00366 
00367 static inline struct osp_update_request *
00368 thandle_to_osp_update_request(struct thandle *th)
00369 {
00370         struct osp_thandle *oth;
00371 
00372         oth = thandle_to_osp_thandle(th);
00373         return oth->ot_our;
00374 }
00375 
00376 /* The transaction only include the updates on the remote node, and
00377  * no local updates at all */
00378 static inline bool is_only_remote_trans(struct thandle *th)
00379 {
00380         return th->th_top == NULL;
00381 }
00382 
00383 static inline void osp_objid_buf_prep(struct lu_buf *buf, loff_t *off,
00384                                       __u32 *id, int index)
00385 {
00386         /* Note: through id is only 32 bits, it will also write 64 bits
00387          * for oid to keep compatibility with the previous version. */
00388         buf->lb_buf = (void *)id;
00389         buf->lb_len = sizeof(u64);
00390         *off = sizeof(u64) * index;
00391 }
00392 
00393 static inline void osp_objseq_buf_prep(struct lu_buf *buf, loff_t *off,
00394                                        __u64 *seq, int index)
00395 {
00396         buf->lb_buf = (void *)seq;
00397         buf->lb_len = sizeof(u64);
00398         *off = sizeof(u64) * index;
00399 }
00400 
00401 static inline void osp_buf_prep(struct lu_buf *lb, void *buf, int buf_len)
00402 {
00403         lb->lb_buf = buf;
00404         lb->lb_len = buf_len;
00405 }
00406 
00407 extern struct lu_context_key osp_thread_key;
00408 
00409 static inline struct osp_thread_info *osp_env_info(const struct lu_env *env)
00410 {
00411         struct osp_thread_info *info;
00412 
00413         info = lu_context_key_get(&env->le_ctx, &osp_thread_key);
00414         if (info == NULL) {
00415                 lu_env_refill((struct lu_env *)env);
00416                 info = lu_context_key_get(&env->le_ctx, &osp_thread_key);
00417         }
00418         LASSERT(info);
00419         return info;
00420 }

00424 };

00426 extern struct lu_context_key osp_txn_key;
00427 
00428 static inline struct osp_txn_info *osp_txn_info(struct lu_context *ctx)
00429 {
00430         struct osp_txn_info *info;
00431 
00432         info = lu_context_key_get(ctx, &osp_txn_key);
00433         return info;
00434 }

00436 extern const struct lu_device_operations osp_lu_ops;

00438 static inline int lu_device_is_osp(struct lu_device *d)
00439 {
00440         return ergo(d != NULL && d->ld_ops != NULL, d->ld_ops == &osp_lu_ops);
00441 }

00443 static inline struct osp_device *lu2osp_dev(struct lu_device *d)
00444 {
00445         LASSERT(lu_device_is_osp(d));
00446         return container_of0(d, struct osp_device, opd_dt_dev.dd_lu_dev);
00447 }
00448 
00449 static inline struct lu_device *osp2lu_dev(struct osp_device *d)
00450 {
00451         return &d->opd_dt_dev.dd_lu_dev;
00452 }
00453 
00454 static inline struct osp_device *dt2osp_dev(struct dt_device *d)
00455 {
00456         LASSERT(lu_device_is_osp(&d->dd_lu_dev));
00457         return container_of0(d, struct osp_device, opd_dt_dev);
00458 }

00460 static inline struct osp_object *lu2osp_obj(struct lu_object *o)
00461 {
00462         LASSERT(ergo(o != NULL, lu_device_is_osp(o->lo_dev)));
00463         return container_of0(o, struct osp_object, opo_obj.do_lu);
00464 }
00465 
00466 static inline struct lu_object *osp2lu_obj(struct osp_object *obj)
00467 {
00468         return &obj->opo_obj.do_lu;
00469 }

00471 static inline struct osp_object *osp_obj(const struct lu_object *o)
00472 {
00473         LASSERT(lu_device_is_osp(o->lo_dev));
00474         return container_of0(o, struct osp_object, opo_obj.do_lu);
00475 }

00477 static inline struct osp_object *dt2osp_obj(const struct dt_object *d)
00478 {
00479         return osp_obj(&d->do_lu);
00480 }

00482 static inline struct dt_object *osp_object_child(struct osp_object *o)
00483 {
00484         return container_of0(lu_object_next(osp2lu_obj(o)),
00485                              struct dt_object, do_lu);
00486 }

00493 #define osp_init_rpc_lock(lck) mdc_init_rpc_lock(lck)
00494 
00495 static inline void osp_get_rpc_lock(struct osp_device *osp)
00496 {
00497         struct mdc_rpc_lock *rpc_lock = osp->opd_obd->u.cli.cl_rpc_lock;
00498 
00499         mdc_get_rpc_lock(rpc_lock, NULL);
00500 }
00501 
00502 static inline void osp_put_rpc_lock(struct osp_device *osp)
00503 {
00504         struct mdc_rpc_lock *rpc_lock = osp->opd_obd->u.cli.cl_rpc_lock;
00505 
00506         mdc_put_rpc_lock(rpc_lock, NULL);
00507 }
00508 
00509 static inline int osp_fid_diff(const struct lu_fid *fid1,
00510                                const struct lu_fid *fid2)
00511 {
00512         /* In 2.6+ ost_idx is packed into IDIF FID, while in 2.4 and 2.5 IDIF
00513          * is always FID_SEQ_IDIF(0x100000000ULL), which does not include OST
00514          * index in the seq. So we can not compare IDIF FID seq here */
00515         if (fid_is_idif(fid1) && fid_is_idif(fid2)) {
00516                 __u32 ost_idx1 = fid_idif_ost_idx(fid1);
00517                 __u32 ost_idx2 = fid_idif_ost_idx(fid2);
00518 
00519                 LASSERTF(ost_idx1 == 0 || ost_idx2 == 0 || ost_idx1 == ost_idx2,
00520                          "fid1: "DFID", fid2: "DFID"\n", PFID(fid1),
00521                          PFID(fid2));
00522 
00523                 return fid_idif_id(fid1->f_seq, fid1->f_oid, 0) -
00524                        fid_idif_id(fid2->f_seq, fid2->f_oid, 0);
00525         }
00526 
00527         LASSERTF(fid_seq(fid1) == fid_seq(fid2), "fid1:"DFID
00528                  ", fid2:"DFID"\n", PFID(fid1), PFID(fid2));
00529 
00530         return fid_oid(fid1) - fid_oid(fid2);
00531 }
00532 
00533 
00534 static inline void osp_update_last_fid(struct osp_device *d, struct lu_fid *fid)
00535 {
00536         int diff = osp_fid_diff(fid, &d->opd_last_used_fid);
00537         /*
00538          * we might have lost precreated objects due to VBR and precreate
00539          * orphans, the gap in objid can be calculated properly only here
00540          */
00541         if (diff > 0) {
00542                 if (diff > 1) {
00543                         d->opd_gap_start_fid = d->opd_last_used_fid;
00544                         d->opd_gap_start_fid.f_oid++;
00545                         d->opd_gap_count = diff - 1;
00546                         CDEBUG(D_HA, "Gap in objids: start="DFID", count =%d\n",
00547                                PFID(&d->opd_gap_start_fid), d->opd_gap_count);
00548                 }
00549                 d->opd_last_used_fid = *fid;
00550         }
00551 }
00552 
00553 static int osp_fid_end_seq(const struct lu_env *env, struct lu_fid *fid)
00554 {
00555         if (fid_is_idif(fid)) {
00556                 struct osp_thread_info *info = osp_env_info(env);
00557                 struct ost_id *oi = &info->osi_oi;
00558 
00559                 fid_to_ostid(fid, oi);
00560                 return ostid_id(oi) == IDIF_MAX_OID;
00561         } else {
00562                 return fid_oid(fid) == LUSTRE_DATA_SEQ_MAX_WIDTH;
00563         }
00564 }
00565 
00566 static inline int osp_precreate_end_seq_nolock(const struct lu_env *env,
00567                                                struct osp_device *osp)
00568 {
00569         struct lu_fid *fid = &osp->opd_pre_last_created_fid;
00570 
00571         return osp_fid_end_seq(env, fid);
00572 }
00573 
00574 static inline int osp_precreate_end_seq(const struct lu_env *env,
00575                                         struct osp_device *osp)
00576 {
00577         int rc;
00578 
00579         spin_lock(&osp->opd_pre_lock);
00580         rc = osp_precreate_end_seq_nolock(env, osp);
00581         spin_unlock(&osp->opd_pre_lock);
00582         return rc;
00583 }
00584 
00585 static inline int osp_is_fid_client(struct osp_device *osp)
00586 {
00587         struct obd_import *imp = osp->opd_obd->u.cli.cl_import;
00588 
00589         return imp->imp_connect_data.ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_FID;
00590 }
00591 
00592 struct object_update *
00593 update_buffer_get_update(struct object_update_request *request,
00594                          unsigned int index);
00595 
00596 int osp_extend_update_buffer(const struct lu_env *env,
00597                              struct osp_update_request *our);
00598 
00599 struct osp_update_request_sub *
00600 osp_current_object_update_request(struct osp_update_request *our);
00601 
00602 int osp_object_update_request_create(struct osp_update_request *our,
00603                                      size_t size);
00604 
00605 #define osp_update_rpc_pack(env, name, our, op, ...)                    \
00606 ({                                                                      \
00607         struct object_update    *object_update;                         \
00608         size_t                  max_update_length;                      \
00609         struct osp_update_request_sub *ours;                            \
00610         int ret;                                                        \
00611                                                                         \
00612         while (1) {                                                     \
00613                 ours = osp_current_object_update_request(our);          \
00614                 LASSERT(ours != NULL);                                  \
00615                 max_update_length = ours->ours_req_size -               \
00616                             object_update_request_size(ours->ours_req); \
00617                                                                         \
00618                 object_update = update_buffer_get_update(ours->ours_req,\
00619                                          ours->ours_req->ourq_count);   \
00620                 ret = out_##name##_pack(env, object_update,             \
00621                                         &max_update_length,             \
00622                                        __VA_ARGS__);                    \
00623                 if (ret == -E2BIG) {                                    \
00624                         int rc1;                                        \
00625                         /* Create new object update request */          \
00626                         rc1 = osp_object_update_request_create(our,     \
00627                                 max_update_length  +                    \
00628                                 offsetof(struct object_update_request,  \
00629                                          ourq_updates[0]) + 1);         \
00630                         if (rc1 != 0) {                                 \
00631                                 ret = rc1;                              \
00632                                 break;                                  \
00633                         }                                               \
00634                         continue;                                       \
00635                 } else {                                                \
00636                         if (ret == 0) {                                 \
00637                                 ours->ours_req->ourq_count++;           \
00638                                 (our)->our_update_nr++;                 \
00639                                 object_update->ou_batchid =             \
00640                                                      (our)->our_batchid;\
00641                                 object_update->ou_flags |=              \
00642                                                      (our)->our_flags;  \
00643                         }                                               \
00644                         break;                                          \
00645                 }                                                       \
00646         }                                                               \
00647         ret;                                                            \
00648 })
00649 
00650 static inline bool osp_send_update_thread_running(struct osp_device *osp)
00651 {
00652         return osp->opd_update_thread.t_flags & SVC_RUNNING;
00653 }
00654 
00655 static inline bool osp_send_update_thread_stopped(struct osp_device *osp)
00656 {
00657         return osp->opd_update_thread.t_flags & SVC_STOPPED;
00658 }

00697 static inline void osp_thandle_get(struct osp_thandle *oth)
00698 {
00699         atomic_inc(&oth->ot_refcount);

00701 
00702 static inline void osp_thandle_put(struct osp_thandle *oth)
00703 {
00704         if (atomic_dec_and_test(&oth->ot_refcount))
00705                 osp_thandle_destroy(oth);
00706 }
